IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO AID IN ELIMINATING POVERTY IN CUYAHOGA COUNTY, OHIO.
IRS990.MissionDesc: STEP FORWARD'S MISSION IS TO PROPEL EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT AND ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY FOR MULTIPLE GENERATIONS THROUGHOUT CUYAHOGA COUNTY.
IRS990.Desc: COMMUNITY SERVICE AND HOUSING ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS - COMMUNITY SERVICES TO PROVIDE ELIGIBLE LOW INCOME PARTICIPANTS WITH VARIOUS SERVICES AND TO SUPPORT OTHER PROGRAM ACTIVITY.HOUSING ASSISTANCE- STEP FORWARD'S NEIGHBORHOOD OPPORTUNITY CENTER PROCESSED ONLINE APPLICATIONS WHICH CONSISTED OF HOUSING ASSISTANCE FROM THE TIME FRAME OF 2/1/2022-1/31/2023. STEP FORWARD SUPPORTED 3,700 UNDUPLICATED HOUSEHOLDS OF CUYAHOGA COUNTY WITH HOUSING ASSISTANCE UNDER FIVE GRANTS-CSBG, CSBG-CARES, CDBG, HRG AND CFR. THE ACTIVITY OBJECTIVES WAS MAINTAINING THEIR HOUSEHOLD BY AVOIDING EVICTIONS, FORECLOSURES, AND UTILITY DISCONNECTIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CHILD EDUCATION - STEP FORWARD'S HEAD START PROGRAM SERVED 1,985 CHILDREN THROUGHOUT THE GREATER CLEVELAND COMMUNITY. IN PARTNERSHIP, STEP FORWARD AND ITS PARTNERS DELIVER HIGH-QUALITY EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS IN SAFE, NURTURING ENVIRONMENTS. IN ADDITION TO AN ENGAGING PRE-SCHOOL ENVIRONMENT, STEP FORWARD HEAD START PROVIDES HEALTH, MENTAL HEALTH AND DENTAL SCREENINGS, NUTRITIOUS MEALS AND FAMILY LITERACY OPPORTUNITIES TO INCORPORATE THE ENTIRE FAMILY INTO THE SPIRIT OF GROWTH AND RESPONSIBILITY.STEP FORWARD'S EARLY HEAD START PROGRAM INCORPORATES THE BELIEF THAT EDUCATION STARTS WHEN LIFE BEGINS. STEP FORWARD IS A STRONG ADVOCATE FOR THE YOUNGEST OF CHILDREN AND THOSE WHO HAVE NOT EVEN BEEN BORN YET. STEP FORWARD SERVED 174 INFANTS, TODDLERS AND PREGNANT WOMEN, THROUGH THE EARLY HEAD START PROGRAM. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES PRENATAL EXAMINATIONS, PARENTING CLASSES, AND QUALITY INFANT CARE TO ELIGIBLE FAMILIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ENERGY ASSISTANCE -STEP FORWARD HELPS LOW-INCOME FAMILIES COPE WITH THE COSTS OF LIVING WITH THE EMERGENCY HOME ENERGY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. THIS PROGRAM RUNS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, PROVIDING FINANCIAL AID FOR BOTH SUMMER COOLING AND WINTER HEATING BILLS. STEP FORWARD SERVED 4,371 HOUSEHOLDS FOR CRISIS ASSISTANCE, CONSISTING OF 14,872 APPLICATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STEP FORWARD IS REQUIRED TO ASSESS WHETHER IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT A TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION ASSUMING THE TAXING AUTHORITY HAS FULL KNOWLEDGE OF ALL INFORMATION. IF THE TAX POSITION DOES NOT MEET THE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT RECOGNITION THRESHOLD, THE BENEFIT OF THAT POSITION IS NOT RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. STEP FORWARD HAS DETERMINED THERE ARE NO AMOUNTS TO RECORD AS ASSETS OR LIABILITIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: ENERGY AND MORTGAGE ASSISTANCE PAYMENTS PROVIDED FOR LOW-INCOME PARTICIPANTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH COMPLIANCE WITH FUNDING SOURCE REQUIREMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED IN A SIMILAR MANNER AS THE ANNUAL AUDIT. A DRAFT COPY IS PROVIDED BY THE AUDIT FIRM. THE PRESIDENT & CEO AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER REVIEW THIS COPY AND MAKE ANY NECESSARY CORRECTIONS. A DRAFT COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE FINAL COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR APPROVAL/ACKNOWLEDGEMENT BEFORE BEING FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE OBLIGATED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST INVOLVING ANY ISSUE PRESENTED AT A BOARD MEETING FOR A VOTE; MEMBERS SHOULD ABSTAIN, WHERE APPROPRIATE, FROM DISCUSSION OR VOTING ON THESE ISSUES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUAL EVALUATION COMPLETED OF PRESIDENT & CEO BY BOARD, COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT & CEO IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD BASED ON WAGE COMPARABILITY STUDY DONE EVERY 3 TO 4 YEARS WHICH IS USED TO CREATE SALARY RANGES. THIS WAGE STUDY WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN 2017. THE PRESIDENT & CEO REVIEWS AND DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION FOR OTHER MANAGEMENT POSITIONS BASED ON ANNUAL EVALUATIONS AND THE SALARY RANGES ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CONTRACTUAL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 6,670,274. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 782,823. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 383. TOTAL EXPENSES 7,453,480.
